patterns: If I add a new chart signal I get the error `This content was not properly loaded`
responses: If you are using your own theme this is caused by missing fields in your theme files. Read mor about this [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#adding-new-chart-signal-gives-this-content-was-not-properly-loaded)

patterns: I'm getting broken image links in my views with the error `400 Bad Request`
responses: This is an error in the IIS web server. Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#broken-image-links)

patterns: When I setup a scheduled task in windows, the task runs in the foreground
responses: Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#my-scheduled-task-runs-in-foreground-blue-box)

patterns: Controller Web touch scroll does not work
responses: Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#controllers-web-swipe-does-not-work-on-panel-pc)

patterns: If I have my own Node.JS application, can I piggy-back on Arrigo's services to manage startup and shutdown?
responses: Yes! Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#use-arrigos-process-management-for-my-own-services)

patterns: Open document work with link icons, why doesn't it work in view buttons
responses: Read more about that [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#arrigo-button-in-view-maneuver-open-document-does-not-work)

patterns: When I try open the User Administration panel I get an error. Why?
responses: Try restarting the browser. Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#user-admin-window-only-shows-an-error)

patterns: Arrigo Services are not starting up after reboot
responses: Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#arrigo-services-are-not-starting-up-after-reboot)

patterns: After a reboot of the server views with code and reports are not displaying correctly
responses: Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#arrigo-services-are-not-starting-up-after-reboot)

patterns: How do I change the bound port in IIS and will Arrigo Local function correctly?
responses: Yes, ***Arrigo Local*** will work just fine with any port you throw at it. Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#change-listeningbound-port-for-iis)

patterns: The login page looks strange and the browser doesn't seem to load all files
responses: This could happen if some MIME types are not configured/set in the IIS. Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#certain-file-types-cannot-be-loaded)

patterns: When I open Arrigo Local and/or check the status I get HTTP error '500.37 - ANCM Failed to Start Within Startup Time Limit'.
responses: The `500.37` error can occur when a large number of apps are configured to start automatically after a restart. Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#http-error-50037)

patterns: When I open Arrigo Local and/or check the status I get HTTP error '500.31 - ANCM Failed to Find Native Dependencies'.
responses: The `500.31` error can occur if something went wrong during the Dotnet Hosting Bundle installation, and the installer wasn't able to detect it. Uninstall the current bundle (*Microsoft .NET Core 3.1.XX - Windows Server Hosting*) and run the Arrigo Local Installer again.

patterns: When I open Arrigo Local and/or check the status I get HTTP error '500.30 - ANCM In-Process Start Failure'.
responses: The `500.30` error could occur if the *ArrigoAppPool* lacks **MODIFY** permissions for the folder `Proj:\Arrigo`. Read more about it [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#http-error-50030)

patterns: When I open Arrigo Local and/or check the status I get HTTP error '500.19 - Internal Server Error'.
responses: The `500.19` error can occur if something went wrong during the Dotnet Hosting Bundle installation, and the installer wasn't able to detect it. Uninstall the current bundle (*Microsoft .NET Core 3.1.XX - Windows Server Hosting*) and run the Arrigo Local Installer again.

patterns: SSL TLS certificate
responses: Don't use self-signed certificates. Buy a valid certificate from a trusted certificate authority. Read more about this [here](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Knowledgebase/00_QnA/#https-and-ssl-certificates)

patterns: I dont see any values in my views
responses: This could be related to WebSockets. Read [this page](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/WebSockets/00_Troubleshooting/) and see if it helps

patterns: What are WebSockets
responses: WebSockets is a technology for bi-directional communication. Read [this page](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/WebSockets/00_Troubleshooting/) for more info

patterns: Open DevTools
responses: Chrome: press F12. Microsoft Edge: press Ctrl+Shift+I

patterns: App Pool
responses: The Arrigo AppPool makes sure that the Arrigo Local API is always up and running

patterns: Restart App Pool
responses: Read [this page](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/00_Restarting%20the%20AppPool/) for more info

patterns: Log files
responses: For Arrigo Local, the logs are stored in `%ProgramFiles/Arrigo/Arrigo Local/InstallLogs` and `%ProgramData%/Arrigo/Arrigo Local/Logs`. Read [this page](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo%20Local/Logging/00_Server%20logs/) for more info

patterns: Calculated meter not working
responses: Read [this page](https://docs.arrigo.se/Troubleshooting/Arrigo.se/Calculated%20Meters/Troubleshooting/) for more info

patterns: What is SSF
responses: Server Side Functions are used to run server-side code in Arrigo Local. Read [this tutorial](https://docs.arrigo.se/Tutorials%20and%20Snippets/ServerSideFunctions/01_Introduction/) for more info
